Description: A circular lid of pale green-grey marl clay pottery. Around the perimeter is a vertical flange, part of which has been broken and is missing. In the centre of the underside is a cylindrical projection to fit the neck of a vessel. A handle was attached in the centre of the slightly domed top, but this has been broken off leaving a hole in its former location.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.109, p.197, pl.39)
